[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/core_account.rs] [guid_creation_num] [u64 overflow] Can guid_creation_num overflow after 2^64 creations, causing GUID collisions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/fixed_supply.rs] [Supply subtraction] [Underflow in burns] Can current_supply underflow during burn operations without proper checked arithmetic? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/fungible_store.rs] [balance increment] [Concurrent overflow] Can concurrent balance increments cause overflow without atomic operations? (Critical)
[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/coin_store.rs] [EventHandle] [Counter manipulation] Can attackers manipulate event handle counters to reorder or duplicate events? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/core_account.rs] [EventHandle creation] [EventKey collision] Can EventKey::new() create colliding keys that merge different accounts' event streams? (High)
[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/collection.rs] [mutation_events] [Event spam] Can attackers spam mutation events to cause storage bloat or DoS? (Low)
[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/token_store.rs] [Multiple event handles] [Event consistency] Can inconsistent states across multiple event handles cause tracking errors? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/collections.rs] [Table handle] [Handle forgery] Can attackers forge Table handles to access arbitrary table data? (Critical)
[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/pending_claims.rs] [Table operations] [Concurrent access] Can concurrent table operations cause race conditions in claim processing? (High)
[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/token_store.rs] [Table handle] [Cross-account access] Can Table handles from one account be used to access another account's tokens? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/aggregator.rs] [TableHandle] [State key forgery] Can StateKey::table_item() be exploited with forged TableHandle to corrupt arbitrary state? (Critical)
[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/coin_info.rs] [WriteSet operations] [Atomic consistency] Can to_writeset() create non-atomic writes where CoinInfo and supply diverge? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/aggregator.rs] [AggregatorV1Resource] [Dual storage] Does storing aggregator metadata separately from value create consistency vulnerabilities? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/fungible_store.rs] [Migration] [Inconsistent migration] Can partial migration between coin and fungible asset systems create inconsistent state? (Critical)
[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/fixed_supply.rs + unlimited_supply.rs] [Supply tracking] Are supply invariants maintained across all operations, or can they be violated? (High)
